snippet: As Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg’s term nears its end, New York arts organizations are worried about life without a rich leader who can privately fatten their budgets.
abstract: Cloud of unease descends over New York City arts world, with less than six months remaining in Mayor Michael R Bloomberg’s term; over his 12 years in office, arts executives, fund-raisers and artists have grown accustomed to a City Hall that was receptive to their needs, as well as to a billionaire mayor who could privately bolster their budgets, but worries abound about what is to come after Bloomberg steps down.

byline.original: By ROBIN POGREBIN and MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM

lead_paragraph: As Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg’s term nears its end, New York arts organizations are worried about life without a rich leader who can privately fatten their budgets.

headline.main: Art Groups Fear Losing a Mayor, and His Money
headline.print_headline: Art World Fears Losing a Mayor, And His Money
